New Records: Arshdeep Singh is now India's fifth-most prolific T20I wicket-taker with 86 scalps
Key Match Events: Arshdeep Singh ran through Bangladesh's batters with 3-14
Varun Chakravarthy scythed through the middle overs with 3-31
Washington Sundar had Najmul Hossain Shanto caught and bowled
Arshdeep Singh ended the innings with a pinpoint yorker
Post-Match Reflections: Hardik Pandya continued to have his way with Bangladesh, topping the chase with a no-look ramp over the keeper's head
Sanju Samson will be disappointed he fell to a hoick the first ball of offspin he faced
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Gwalior pitch had slightly uneven bounce and an accurate Indian attack
India's best powerplay against Bangladesh in T20Is was 71, which is just the fourth-highest they have conceded in powerplays
Others: Debutants Mayank Yadav and Nitish Kumar Reddy started their international careers with a maiden over and a maiden over respectively
Varun Chakravarthy showed no ring rust on his T20I return
